Package com.iontrading.mkv.messagequeue

Class MkvMQ

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iontrading.mkv.messagequeue.MkvMQ
  • @Keep
@KeepPublicClassMemberNames
public class MkvMQ
extends Object
    The MkvMQ class wraps ION Message Queue functionality in a Java Object.

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroy this MessageQueue.

        Destroying the message queue entails releasing all the resources associated with the queue, in particular the record underlying the message queue implementation is unpublished along with its type if the latter is no longer used by other queues.
        The MkvMQManager.create factory method allows to associate a listener with the message queue; this listener is invoked on queue destruction so to notify the event and provide a last change of accessing unacknowledged items in the queue.

      • put

        public void put​(MkvMQAction action)
         throws MkvMQClosedException,
                MkvMQFullException,
                MkvException
        Adds an action value to the queue.

        This method works as if by invoking the three-argument put(MkvSupply supply, String record, MkvMQAction action) method with a dummy supply argument, empty string and the provided action.

        Parameters:
        action - the action
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If action is null
        MkvMQClosedException - If the queue is closed
        MkvMQFullException - If the queue is full (i.e. adding an element would exceed the queue MaxSize limit) *
        MkvException - If a supply field is not set
        See Also:
        put(MkvSupply, String, MkvMQAction)

      • put

        public void put​(MkvSupply supply)
         throws MkvMQClosedException,
                MkvMQFullException,
                MkvInvalidSupplyException,
                MkvException
        Adds a value to the queue.

        This method works as if by invoking the three-argument put(MkvSupply supply, String record, MkvMQAction action) method with the given record, the record set to the empty string and an action set to MkvMQAction.ADD.

        Parameters:
        supply - the record image
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If supply is null
        MkvMQClosedException - If the queue is closed
        MkvMQFullException - If the queue is full (i.e. adding an element would exceed the queue MaxSize limit)
        MkvInvalidSupplyException - If the supply doesn't match the queue type
        MkvException - If a supply field is not set
        See Also:
        put(MkvSupply, String, MkvMQAction)

      • put

        public void put​(MkvSupply supply,
                String record)
         throws MkvMQClosedException,
                MkvMQFullException,
                MkvInvalidSupplyException,
                MkvException
        Adds a value to the queue.

        This method works as if by invoking the three-argument put(MkvSupply supply, String record, MkvMQAction action) method with the given record, string and an action set to MkvMQAction.ADD.

        Parameters:
        supply - the record image
        record - the record name
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If supply or record are null
        MkvMQClosedException - If the queue is closed
        MkvMQFullException - If the queue is full (i.e. adding an element would exceed the queue MaxSize limit)
        MkvInvalidSupplyException - If the supply doesn't match the queue type
        MkvException - If a supply field is not set
        See Also:
        put(MkvSupply, String, MkvMQAction)

      • putUserAction

        public void putUserAction​(MkvSupply supply,
                          String userAction)
                   throws MkvMQClosedException,
                          MkvMQFullException,
                          MkvInvalidSupplyException,
                          MkvException
        Adds a value to the queue, annotated with a user defined string.

        The record and string are provided as a means to support in-band notification of application specific-protocol events or conditions, the API doesn't perform any logic on these. An exception is thrown if the provided record image is not a full supply for the queue type.

        Parameters:
        supply - the record image
        userAction - a "user action" string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If supply of userAction are null
        MkvMQClosedException - If the queue is closed
        MkvMQFullException - If the queue is full (i.e. adding an element would exceed the queue MaxSize limit)
        MkvInvalidSupplyException - If the supply doesn't match the queue type
        MkvException - If a supply field is not set

      • putUserAction

        public void putUserAction​(String userAction)
                   throws MkvMQClosedException,
                          MkvMQFullException,
                          MkvInvalidSupplyException,
                          MkvException
        Adds a dummy element to the queue, annotated with a user defined string.

        The string is provided as a means to support in-band notification of application specific-protocol events or conditions, the API doesn't perform any logic on it.

        Parameters:
        userAction - a "user action" string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If userAction is null
        MkvMQClosedException - If the queue is closed
        MkvMQFullException - If the queue is full (i.e. adding an element would exceed the queue MaxSize limit)
        MkvInvalidSupplyException - If the supply doesn't match the queue type
        MkvException - If a supply field is not set

      • put

        public void put​(MkvSupply supply,
                String record,
                MkvMQAction action)
         throws MkvMQClosedException,
                MkvMQFullException,
                MkvInvalidSupplyException,
                MkvException
        Adds a value to the queue.

        The record and action are provided as a means to support application specific publish/subscribe interactions: the API doesn't perform any logic on these. An exception is thrown if the provided record image is not a full supply for the queue type.

        Parameters:
        supply - the record image
        record - the record name
        action - the action
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If record, supply or action are null
        MkvMQClosedException - If the queue is closed
        MkvMQFullException - If the queue is full (i.e. adding an element would exceed the queue MaxSize limit)
        MkvInvalidSupplyException - If the supply doesn't match the queue type
        MkvException - If a supply field is not set

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the current size of the Message Queue.
        Returns:
        the current size of the Message Queue.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws MkvMQClosedException
        Flushes pending values, if any.

        The flush operation entails synchronization of publisher and subscriber.

        Throws:
        MkvMQClosedException - If the queue is closed
        See Also:
        MkvMQConf.setFlowSize(int)

      • flush

        public void flush​(MkvMQAckReplyListener ackReplyLner)
           throws MkvMQClosedException
        Flushes pending values, if any. The MkvMQAckReplyListener in input will be notified when the queue subscriber has successfully synchronized with the publisher.
        Parameters:
        ackReplyLner - The listener to be notified on subscriber's synchronization.
        Throws:
        MkvMQClosedException - If the queue is closed
        See Also:
        flush()

      • setError

        public void setError​(String error)
              throws MkvException
        Updates the error status and raises an out-of-band error notification
        Parameters:
        error - the error message
        Throws:
        MkvException - in case of any problem setting the error on the MessageQueue

      • close

        public void close​(int timeout)
        Closes this message queue.

        A closed message queue is kept alive to give the subscriber the chance to receive pending messages; no more messages can be sent on a closed queue.
        Closing a queue sends a close message on the queue to explicitly notify the queue consumer, then schedules the destroy method to be invoked in timeout seconds unless the timeout is zero; in that case the queue will stick around until it is explicitly destroyed.

        Parameters:
        timeout - how many seconds the queue will linger after being closed; 0 stands for no timeout
        See Also:
        destroy()
